Player History
Signed as a free agent by Chicago (A) on 4/1/1985 to a minor league deal...
Signed as a free agent by Montreal on 4/3/1985 to a minor league deal...
Injured on 5/22/1988 with a Strained Back Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
Had first career hit (double) on 7/5/1988, off Terry Leach (SD)...
Hit first career homerun on 7/7/1988, off Marty Bystrom (SD)...
Traded from Montreal to Detroit on 7/27/1990 (Going to MON: P Johnny Ruffin, CF Billy Ashley. Going to DET: 3B Randy Velarde)...
2/2/1991: Gets a new one-year contract worth $650,000 through salary arbitration...
2/2/1992: Gets a new one-year contract worth $940,000 through salary arbitration...
Injured on 4/3/1992 with a Inflamed Abdominal Muscle, out for 1-2 weeks...
2/2/1993: Gets a new one-year contract worth $1,707,143 through salary arbitration...
7/5/1993: Signed a contract extension with Detroit, $3,100,000 per year, for 3 years.
7/26/1993: Signed a contract extension with Detroit, $3,100,000 per year, for 3 years.
